triples.name: TOPSIS
triples.relevance: TOPSIS is one of the two main multi-criteria decision-making methods applied in this paper for ranking and selecting promotional products.

triples.name: Multiple-criteria decision analysis
triples.relevance: Both SWARA and TOPSIS are MCDA methods used to handle the multiple competing criteria in product selection.

triples.name: E-commerce
triples.relevance: E-commerce is the primary application domain for this product selection research, addressing promotional challenges in online retail.

triples.name: Customer satisfaction
triples.relevance: Customer satisfaction is identified as the business goal that promotional products are intended to improve.

triples.name: Decision-making
triples.relevance: Decision-making is the core problem being solved through the application of SWARA and TOPSIS methods.

triples.name: Decision-matrix method
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a novel application of decision-matrix methods (SWARA and TOPSIS) specifically designed for e-commerce promotional product selection.
